episodeTitleJapanese: 誇り高き男！銀ギツネのフォクシー
episodeTitleRomanized: Hokori takaki otoko! gin Gitsune no Fokushī
description: The Straw Hat crew rescues Foxy, Hamburg, and Porche from a storm at sea. Upon reuniting with the Sexy Foxy ship, they discover it's under new command by Kibagaeru of the Fanged Toad Pirates. Foxy accepts a Davy Back Fight to reclaim his vessel. Meanwhile, at Marine Headquarters, the Five Elders learn that Admiral Aokiji has taken his bike to sea.

events.title: Marine Headquarters Discovers Aokiji's Absence
events.description: At Marine Headquarters, a sailor reports to an officer that they cannot find Admiral Aokiji anywhere and that he has taken his bike, probably to the open sea. This information is relayed to the Five Elders, who express their dismay at the Admiral's unsanctioned departure.
events.significance: Establishes Aokiji's independent nature and foreshadows his upcoming encounter with the Straw Hats. This scene shows the Admiral's casual disregard for protocol, which contrasts with his high rank.

events.title: Aokiji's First Appearance (Shadowed)
events.description: A tall mysterious figure is seen riding a bicycle across the ocean surface, holding Luffy's wanted poster. His face is blocked by the sun, creating a silhouette. He comments on how trouble seems to run in the Monkey family, hinting at his knowledge of Luffy's grandfather.
events.significance: First appearance of Admiral Aokiji in the anime, though his face is not clearly shown. This introduces one of the three Admirals and sets up his confrontation with the Straw Hats. His ability to ride across the ocean demonstrates his Ice-Ice Fruit powers.

quotes.text: Trouble seems to run in the Monkey family.
quotes.speaker: Aokiji
quotes.context: While looking at Luffy's wanted poster and riding his bike across the ocean

events.title: Straw Hats Encounter Storm at Sea
events.description: The Straw Hat crew navigates through a fierce storm. Nami directs the crew on how to handle the rough weather while they maintain course.
events.significance: Sets up the circumstance that leads to rescuing Foxy and his crewmates, bringing them back into the story.

events.title: Rescue of Foxy Pirates from Storm
events.description: The Straw Hats discover Foxy, Hamburg, and Porche stranded on a small boat in the middle of the storm. Despite their previous antagonism, Luffy decides to rescue them. The three are brought aboard the Going Merry.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's compassionate nature and his willingness to help even former enemies. This act of kindness will be tested shortly after.

events.title: Foxy's Fake Illness Act
events.description: Foxy pretends to be gravely ill and near death, playing on the Straw Hats' sympathies. Usopp falls for the act completely, while Zoro and others remain skeptical. Chopper as the doctor tends to him.
events.significance: Showcases Foxy's deceptive nature and Usopp's gullible personality. Sets up the betrayal that follows.

events.title: Foxy's Betrayal
events.description: After recovering, Foxy reveals his true intentions and betrays the Straw Hats who rescued him. He dumps them through a trapdoor in the ship and announces his plan to cash in on their bounties.
events.significance: Demonstrates the pirate world's harsh reality where even rescued enemies may betray their saviors. However, this is characteristic of Foxy's comedic villainy rather than true danger.

quotes.text: I'm going to cash in on your bounty!
quotes.speaker: Foxy
quotes.context: After betraying the Straw Hats who rescued him

events.title: Discovery of the Sexy Foxy Ship
events.description: Foxy, Hamburg, and Porche arrive at their ship, the Sexy Foxy, expecting to rejoin their crew. However, they are shocked to discover the ship is no longer under their control.
events.significance: Sets up the main conflict of the episode - Foxy must reclaim his ship from a usurper.

events.title: Kibagaeru Reveals Himself as New Captain
events.description: Kibagaeru, the former captain of the Fanged Toad Pirates, emerges and announces that he is now the captain of the Sexy Foxy ship and crew. He reveals that he took over after Foxy's defeat in the previous Davy Back Fight.
events.significance: Introduces the antagonist for this filler arc. Kibagaeru represents the consequences of Foxy's previous loss and the harsh rules of the Davy Back Fight.

quotes.text: I own this ship and everything aboard it now!
quotes.speaker: Kibagaeru
quotes.context: Announcing his takeover of the Sexy Foxy

events.title: Foxy Challenges Kibagaeru to Davy Back Fight
events.description: Foxy, refusing to accept the loss of his ship and crew, challenges Kibagaeru to a Davy Back Fight in order to reclaim what he lost. Kibagaeru accepts the challenge, confident in his ability to defeat Foxy again.
events.significance: Establishes the conflict resolution method for this arc - another Davy Back Fight. This callback to the previous Long Ring Long Land arc shows how these pirate games can have lasting consequences.

events.title: Foxy's Slow Slow Beam Reflected
events.description: During the initial confrontation, Foxy launches his signature Slow Slow Beam at Kibagaeru. However, Kibagaeru deflects it back at Foxy using a shield made of swords, causing Foxy to be affected by his own power.
events.significance: Demonstrates Kibagaeru's tactical abilities and shows that Foxy's signature move can be countered. This puts Foxy at a disadvantage in the upcoming fight.

events.title: Foxy Struggles in Battle
events.description: As the fight progresses, Foxy struggles against Kibagaeru's tactics and strength. It becomes clear that Foxy is outmatched and may lose his ship and crew permanently.
events.significance: Shows Foxy's desperation and sets up the need for outside help, likely from Luffy and the Straw Hats.

events.title: Luffy Receives the Afro
events.description: In a moment of desperation, Foxy gives Luffy the afro that Luffy previously used in the boxing match against him. Luffy removes his iconic straw hat and puts on the afro, preparing to fight.
events.significance: Callbacks to Luffy's championship afro from the Long Ring Long Land arc. The afro is treated as a power-up that makes Luffy stronger in combat, serving as a comedic element.

events.title: Kibagaeru Refuses to Fight Luffy
events.description: When Luffy prepares to fight, Kibagaeru initially refuses to battle someone with a 100 million Belly bounty, recognizing the significant difference in their threat levels.
events.significance: Acknowledges Luffy's growing reputation and bounty. Shows that even filler antagonists recognize the Straw Hat captain's strength.

events.title: Chopper's Romantic Subplot with Porche
events.description: Throughout the episode, there are hints of a developing romantic subplot between Chopper and Porche, with comedic moments of Chopper's bashfulness.
events.significance: Provides character development for Chopper and adds a romantic comedy element to the filler arc.

quotes.text: Trouble seems to run in the Monkey family.
quotes.speaker: Aokiji
quotes.context: While looking at Luffy's wanted poster and riding his bike across the ocean

quotes.text: I'm going to cash in on your bounty!
quotes.speaker: Foxy
quotes.context: After betraying the Straw Hats who rescued him

quotes.text: I own this ship and everything aboard it now!
quotes.speaker: Kibagaeru
quotes.context: Announcing his takeover of the Sexy Foxy

themes.description: The episode explores themes of betrayal as Foxy turns on the Straw Hats despite being rescued by them, while also showing how Foxy himself was betrayed by Kibagaeru.
themes.symbolism: The storm represents chaos and uncertainty, while the Davy Back Fight represents the pirate code's harsh but fair system of conflict resolution.

themes.description: Foxy's pride as a pirate captain drives him to reclaim his ship and crew through the Davy Back Fight rather than accepting defeat.
themes.symbolism: The afro symbolizes Luffy's willingness to help even former enemies when they show genuine need.

themes.description: Despite their previous antagonism, Luffy rescues Foxy from the storm, showing his compassionate nature transcends grudges.

characterSpotlights.development: Foxy's pride and desperation are on full display as he goes from rescued victim to betrayer to desperate former captain trying to reclaim his position.
keyActions: Rescued from storm by Straw Hats
Challenges Kibagaeru to Davy Back Fight
Gives Luffy the afro to help him
quotes: I'm going to cash in on your bounty!

characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as the new captain of the Sexy Foxy, showing cunning and combat ability by deflecting Foxy's Slow Slow Beam.
keyActions: Reveals himself as new captain of Sexy Foxy
Deflects Foxy's Slow Slow Beam with sword shield
Refuses to fight Luffy due to his high bounty
quotes: I own this ship and everything aboard it now!

characterSpotlights.development: Shows his characteristic compassion by rescuing former enemies and his readiness to help Foxy reclaim his ship by wearing the afro again.
keyActions: Rescues Foxy and crew from storm
Puts on the afro to fight for Foxy

characterSpotlights.development: First appearance in the anime (though shadowed), establishing his independent nature and hinting at upcoming confrontation with the Straw Hats.
quotes: Trouble seems to run in the Monkey family.

mangaDifferences.difference: This entire episode is anime-original filler. The Foxy's Return Arc does not appear in the manga.
Kibagaeru and the Fanged Toad Pirates are anime-only characters created for this filler arc.
The Aokiji scene corresponds to Chapter 303 page 19 in the manga, but was expanded for the anime.

trivia.fact: Episode 225 is the first episode of the Foxy's Return Arc, which is widely considered one of the least popular filler arcs in One Piece.
This episode aired with a TV rating of 10.5% in Japan, indicating solid viewership despite being a filler episode.
The episode was broadcast in 16:9 HDTV format, as One Piece had transitioned to high definition starting from episode 207.
Aokiji's bike is named 'Ao Chari' and his ability to ride it across the ocean is due to his Hie Hie no Mi (Ice-Ice Fruit) powers freezing the water beneath him.
The Foxy's Return Arc (episodes 225-228) is considered skippable by most fans, with the only redeeming feature being Aokiji's introduction at the end.
Kibagaeru's name is a combination of 'kiba' (fang) and 'gaeru' (frog), directly referencing his Fanged Toad Pirates crew.
The opening theme 'Kokoro no Chizu' by BOYSTYLE is one of the most beloved One Piece openings among fans.
